alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 18 at 7:32PM CDT until September 19 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN VAN BUREN...NORTHEASTERN SCOTLAND AND NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 731 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Milton, or 9 miles southwest of Keosauqua, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Lebanon around 735 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Cantril, Lake Sugema Campground, Lacey Keosauqua State Park, Van Buren County Fairgrounds, Keosauqua, Keosauqua Airport, Mount Sterling, Bentonsport/Vernon and Heath Memorial Conservation Area. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
